tool.name: Merging

param.name: molwt_cutoff
param.label: Maximum molecular weight of a generated compound

param.name: iteration_depth
param.label: The maximum of iteration depth of a fragment
param.help: 0 means the iteration depth will be calaculated from the sticky ends from each molecule.

param.name: repeats
param.label: Number of repeats
param.help: Number of repeats all new created fragments should be merged against the inital ones.

tool.help:
.. class:: infomark
**What this tool does**
Merging small molecules together to larger compounds using predifined reactions.
*Available options::*
Maximum iteration depth: A fragment can have more than one sticky end. Hence, it can be part of more than one merging step. If you combine two fragments with more than one sticky end you can end up in a combinatorial explosing. With these parameters you can set the maximum iteration deph of all compounds. An iteration depth of 0 means the value is set to the number of sticky ends of each molecule separately.
Number of repeats: If you have palindromic compounds it can happen that not all possible combinations are generated with the 'maxiumum iteration depth' option. So solve that you can increse the number of repetitions. But be aware it can generate an exhausive list of compounds and doubles/triples ... the computation time.
-----
.. class:: warningmark
**Hint**
| Only fragments with marked sticky ends can be merged. To get such a file check the appropriate option in the fragmenter tool. | | With the options *Molecule dependend iteration depth* and *Number of repeats* you can adjust the created number of compounds and the actual computing time. -----
.. class:: infomark
**Input**
A molecule file with marked molecules. You can create such a file with the Fragmenter tool and the option 'mark atoms'.
-----
.. class:: infomark
**Output**
A molecule file with new created/merged molecules.
